channel.title: Mac Friendly Source & Client?
channel.description:
Hey guys, I'm looking into making my own private server.
My only problem is finding a source / client compatible with mac. I've read some posts about how some files are different for different users, and how most people prefer windows / linux. (Well I'm stuck with a mac lol)
If anyone could help me out, it would be much appreciated!
Thanks for your time :) - The Kid

item.title: Mac Friendly Source & Client?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Limits:

I only responded that way because I’ve never seen those types of errors in that large of a quantity before.

Alright, well thanks for being honest at least. Next time instead of getting frustrated and ultimately giving bad advice let someone else take over or try to find a solution, put those Googling skills to the test.

Read full topic

item.title: Mac Friendly Source & Client?
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:24, topic:543553”][quote author=Limits link=topic=662433.msg4428514#msg4428514 date=1402013747]

Bump.

Anyone have a source & client ready to go for mac?

I just wanna play a custom server with some friends with admin/mod powers.
Lol, & We might open up a server in the future.

But for now, I’m just looking for a mac ready source + client that needs minimal edits. Lol.

Don’t listen to those morons above, cough Limits

Your source is fine; the error you displayed after compiling and after running indicates you’re using the wrong version of Java. The compiled errors that of switching strings, that feature became available in Java Development Kit update 7. Once you update and scrap the older versions of Java that you have feel free to come back with any more problems if they arise.

[hr]

Also after this experience I would HIGHLY suggest getting an IDE.

A very popular one is Eclipse.

Moron?
[/quote]

Yes.

IDEs are for people who cant work their computers. Its like an obesity scooter for a fat person.

Get a new source. This one’s garbage apparently. It isn’t you don’t worry.

EDIT: I can give you one if you like, what revision would you prefer?

You clearly do not understand the concept of an IDE, rather you think they are for lazy people who “can’t work their computers”

Because you cannot fix a simple run time error you claim the source is garbage, logic?[/quote]

I only responded that way because I’ve never seen those types of errors in that large of a quantity before.

Read full topic

item.title: Mac Friendly Source & Client?
item.dc:creator: @Sideoutkid Sideoutkid
item.description:
@Sideoutkid wrote:

[quote=“Docent, post:11, topic:543553”][quote author=Sideoutkid link=topic=662433.msg4427635#msg4427635 date=1401585709]

Okay, So I’ve replaced everything within the run.sh file with what you suggested.
I still get an error when I try to paste in “Java -Xmx500m server” into the terminal.

Also when I was following the TuT to Compile, I followed instructions and as soon as I did the " javac *.java" in the terminal I got this -

[quote]Last login: Sat May 31 17:58:55 on ttys000
Brandons-MacBook-Pro:~ brandongunda$ cd /Users/brandongunda/Desktop/DevilsScape\ Server
Brandons-MacBook-Pro:DevilsScape Server brandongunda$ javac *.java
javac: file not found: *.java
Usage: javac
use -help for a list of possible options
Brandons-MacBook-Pro:DevilsScape Server brandongunda$

It says it can’t find a file, so does that mean my source is incomplete?

Ok scratch all that. Go to http://macromates.com and download “TextMate” it’s the tool I use for all my coding. You can then open .sh files through this program and press Command + R to run it. Nice and simple. Tell me how it goes
[/quote]

Okay when I try to run the run.sh file with TextMate I get this.

[quote]Exception in thread “main” java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: neo/Execute : Unsupported major.minor version 51.0
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClassCond(ClassLoader.java:637)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:621)
at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(SecureClassLoader.java:141)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:283)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$000(URLClassLoader.java:58)
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:197)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:190)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306)
at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:301)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:247)[/quote]

And I haven’t changed anything in my compile.sh file so it still has this

[quote]@echo off
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_45\bin\javac" -d bin -cp lib/*; -sourcepath src src/neo/Execute.java
pause[/quote]

Sorry for all the trouble, I really do appreciate your time and effort into helping me out! :o
[/quote]

Change the compile code to [quote]
javac -d bin -cp lib/*: -sourcepath src src/neo/Execute.java[/quote][/quote]

Okay I get 29 Errors when I try to compile. Lol.
The struggle just became even more realer.

Rank.java:380: incompatible types found : java.lang.String required: int switch (getName()) { ^ Task.java:72: incompatible types found : java.lang.String required: int switch (getCurrentTask()) { ^ Achievements.java:71: incompatible types found : java.lang.String required: int switch (getCurrentAchievement()) { ^ Default.java:200: inconvertible types found : java.lang.Object required: int if((int) player.getTemporaryAttribute("bones") == GildedAltar.Bones.REGULAR_BONES.getId()) { ^ Default.java:204: inconvertible types found : java.lang.Object required: int } else if((int) player.getTemporaryAttribute("bones") == GildedAltar.Bones.BURNT_BONES.getId()) { ^ Default.java:208: inconvertible types found : java.lang.Object required: int } else if((int) player.getTemporaryAttribute("bones") == GildedAltar.Bones.WOLF_BONES.getId()) { ^ Default.java:212: inconvertible types found : java.lang.Object required: int } else if((int) player.getTemporaryAttribute("bones") == GildedAltar.Bones.MONKEY_BONES.getId()) { ^ Default.java:216: inconvertible types found : java.lang.Object required: int } else if((int) player.getTemporaryAttribute("bones") == GildedAltar.Bones.BIG_BONES.getId()) { ^ Default.java:224: inconvertible types found : java.lang.Object required: int } else if((int) player.getTemporaryAttribute("bones") == GildedAltar.Bones.JOGRE_BONES.getId()) { ^ Default.java:228: inconvertible types found : java.lang.Object required: int } else if((int) player.getTemporaryAttribute("bones") == GildedAltar.Bones.ZOGRE_BONES.getId()) { ^ Default.java:232: inconvertible types found : java.lang.Object required: int } else if((int) player.getTemporaryAttribute("bones") == GildedAltar.Bones.BABY_DRAGON_BONES.getId()) { ^ Default.java:240: inconvertible types found : java.lang.Object required: int } else if((int) player.getTemporaryAttribute("bones") == GildedAltar.Bones.WYVERN_BONES.getId()) { ^ Default.java:244: inconvertible types found : java.lang.Object required: int } else if((int) player.getTemporaryAttribute("bones") == GildedAltar.Bones.DRAGON_BONES.getId()) { ^ Default.java:248: inconvertible types found : java.lang.Object required: int } else if((int) player.getTemporaryAttribute("bones") == GildedAltar.Bones.FAYRG_BONES.getId()) { ^ Default.java:252: inconvertible types found : java.lang.Object required: int } else if((int) player.getTemporaryAttribute("bones") == GildedAltar.Bones.RAURG_BONES.getId()) { ^ Default.java:256: inconvertible types found : java.lang.Object required: int } else if((int) player.getTemporaryAttribute("bones") == GildedAltar.Bones.DAGANNOTH_BONES.getId()) { ^ Default.java:260: inconvertible types found : java.lang.Object required: int } else if((int) player.getTemporaryAttribute("bones") == GildedAltar.Bones.OURG_BONES.getId()) { ^ Default.java:264: inconvertible types found : java.lang.Object required: int } else if((int) player.getTemporaryAttribute("bones") == GildedAltar.Bones.FROST_DRAGON_BONES.getId()) { ^ Commands.java:83: incompatible types found : java.lang.String required: int switch (arg[0]) { ^ Commands.java:884: incompatible types found : java.lang.String required: int switch (arg[0]) { ^ ActionButtonPacketHandler.java:4916: inconvertible types found : java.lang.Object required: int skillMenu = (int) player.getTemporaryAttribute("skillMenu"); ^ ItemPacketHandler.java:1481: incompatible types found : java.lang.String required: int switch (objectDef.name.toLowerCase()) { ^ ExaminePacketHandler.java:91: incompatible types found : java.lang.String required: int switch(object.getDefinitions().name.toLowerCase()) { ^ 29 errors compile.sh: line 2: pause: command not found

item.title: Mac Friendly Source & Client?
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

[quote=“Sideoutkid, post:10, topic:543553”][quote author=Docent link=topic=662433.msg4427634#msg4427634 date=1401585059]

Okay, So I’ve replaced everything within the run.sh file with what you suggested.
I still get an error when I try to paste in “Java -Xmx500m server” into the terminal.

Also when I was following the TuT to Compile, I followed instructions and as soon as I did the " javac *.java" in the terminal I got this -

[quote]Last login: Sat May 31 17:58:55 on ttys000
Brandons-MacBook-Pro:~ brandongunda$ cd /Users/brandongunda/Desktop/DevilsScape\ Server
Brandons-MacBook-Pro:DevilsScape Server brandongunda$ javac *.java
javac: file not found: *.java
Usage: javac
use -help for a list of possible options
Brandons-MacBook-Pro:DevilsScape Server brandongunda$

It says it can’t find a file, so does that mean my source is incomplete?
[/quote]

Ok scratch all that. Go to http://macromates.com and download “TextMate” it’s the tool I use for all my coding. You can then open .sh files through this program and press Command + R to run it. Nice and simple. Tell me how it goes
[/quote]

Okay when I try to run the run.sh file with TextMate I get this.

[quote]Exception in thread “main” java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: neo/Execute : Unsupported major.minor version 51.0
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClassCond(ClassLoader.java:637)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:621)
at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(SecureClassLoader.java:141)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:283)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$000(URLClassLoader.java:58)
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:197)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:190)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306)
at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:301)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:247)[/quote]

And I haven’t changed anything in my compile.sh file so it still has this

[quote]@echo off
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_45\bin\javac" -d bin -cp lib/*; -sourcepath src src/neo/Execute.java
pause[/quote]

Sorry for all the trouble, I really do appreciate your time and effort into helping me out! :o[/quote]

Change the compile code to

javac -d bin -cp lib/*: -sourcepath src src/neo/Execute.java

Read full topic

Brandons-MacBook-Pro:DevilsScape Server brandongunda$ javac *.java
javac: file not found: *.java

use -help for a list of possible options

[/quote]

It says it can’t find a file, so does that mean my source is incomplete?

Ok scratch all that. Go to http://macromates.com and download “TextMate” it’s the tool I use for all my coding. You can then open .sh files through this program and press Command + R to run it. Nice and simple. Tell me how it goes :)[/quote]

Okay when I try to run the run.sh file with TextMate I get this.

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: neo/Execute : Unsupported major.minor version 51.0 at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClassCond(ClassLoader.java:637) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:621) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(SecureClassLoader.java:141) at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:283) at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$000(URLClassLoader.java:58) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:197) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:190) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:301) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:247)

And I haven’t changed anything in my compile.sh file so it still has this

@echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_45\bin\javac" -d bin -cp lib/*; -sourcepath src src/neo/Execute.java pause

Sorry for all the trouble, I really do appreciate your time and effort into helping me out! :o

item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

[quote=“Sideoutkid, post:8, topic:543553”]Okay, So I’ve replaced everything within the run.sh file with what you suggested.
I still get an error when I try to paste in “Java -Xmx500m server” into the terminal.

Also when I was following the TuT to Compile, I followed instructions and as soon as I did the " javac *.java" in the terminal I got this -

[quote]Last login: Sat May 31 17:58:55 on ttys000
Brandons-MacBook-Pro:~ brandongunda$ cd /Users/brandongunda/Desktop/DevilsScape\ Server
Brandons-MacBook-Pro:DevilsScape Server brandongunda$ javac *.java
javac: file not found: *.java
Usage: javac
use -help for a list of possible options
Brandons-MacBook-Pro:DevilsScape Server brandongunda$

[/quote]

It says it can’t find a file, so does that mean my source is incomplete?[/quote]

Ok scratch all that. Go to http://macromates.com and download “TextMate” it’s the tool I use for all my coding. You can then open .sh files through this program and press Command + R to run it. Nice and simple. Tell me how it goes

Read full topic

item.title: Mac Friendly Source & Client?
item.dc:creator: @Sideoutkid Sideoutkid
item.description:
@Sideoutkid wrote:

[quote=“Docent, post:7, topic:543553”][quote author=Sideoutkid link=topic=662433.msg4427631#msg4427631 date=1401583695]

Any server/client is compatible with Mac, you would just need to reconfigure the files.

Window users use .bat files, and you using Mac, don’t have .bat’s, so if you download a source/client then you need to change all of your .bat files to .sh

example:

runserver.bat compile.bat

needs to be changed to

runserver.sh compile.sh

Those would open as text files. So what you do:

Open Terminal Type "/cd "
Make sure you have a space after /cd
That will create a directory
Then drag the source to your Terminal
that will open your source for Mac.
Then type Java -Xmx500m server and it should be online.

Hope I helped. If not, then follow this tut: https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=423797.0

Okay I didn’t know the files needed to be changed thank you on that.
Also I followed your steps that you’ve provided and I get this error.

[sup]Brandons-MacBook-Pro:DevilsScape Server brandongunda$ Java -Xmx500m server
Exception in thread “main” java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: server
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: server
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:202)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:190)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306)
at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:301)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:247)
Brandons-MacBook-Pro:DevilsScape Server brandongunda$

[/sup]
Any idea?

Alright… so what was in the Run.bat or whatever in the server’s main folder?

Inside the run.bat was

[quote]@echo off
title DevilsScape
cd src
cd …
“C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin\java” -Xmx256m -Xss2m -Dsun.java2d.noddraw=true -XX:+DisableExplicitGC -XX:+AggressiveOpts -XX:+UseAdaptiveGCBoundary -XX:MaxGCPauseMillis=500 -XX:SurvivorRatio=16 -XX:+UseParallelGC -classpath bin;lib/substance.jar;lib/* neo.Execute
pause[/quote]
I’m assuming that something needs to changed since mac doesn’t use “C:” right? Lol or nah…
[/quote]

Replace all that with this:

cd src cd .. java -Xmx256m -Xss2m -Dsun.java2d.noddraw=true -XX:+DisableExplicitGC -XX:+AggressiveOpts -XX:+UseAdaptiveGCBoundary -XX:MaxGCPauseMillis=500 -XX:SurvivorRatio=16 -XX:+UseParallelGC -classpath bin:lib/substance.jar:lib/* neo.Execute[/quote]

Okay, So I’ve replaced everything within the run.sh file with what you suggested.
I still get an error when I try to paste in “Java -Xmx500m server” into the terminal.

Also when I was following the TuT to Compile, I followed instructions and as soon as I did the " javac *.java" in the terminal I got this -

Last login: Sat May 31 17:58:55 on ttys000 Brandons-MacBook-Pro:~ brandongunda$ cd /Users/brandongunda/Desktop/DevilsScape\ Server Brandons-MacBook-Pro:DevilsScape Server brandongunda$ javac *.java javac: file not found: *.java Usage: javac use -help for a list of possible options Brandons-MacBook-Pro:DevilsScape Server brandongunda$

It says it can’t find a file, so does that mean my source is incomplete?

Read full topic

item.title: Mac Friendly Source & Client?
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

[quote=“Sideoutkid, post:6, topic:543553”][quote author=Docent link=topic=662433.msg4427628#msg4427628 date=1401583516]

Any server/client is compatible with Mac, you would just need to reconfigure the files.

Window users use .bat files, and you using Mac, don’t have .bat’s, so if you download a source/client then you need to change all of your .bat files to .sh

example:

runserver.bat compile.bat

needs to be changed to

runserver.sh compile.sh

Those would open as text files. So what you do:

Open Terminal Type "/cd "
Make sure you have a space after /cd
That will create a directory
Then drag the source to your Terminal
that will open your source for Mac.
Then type Java -Xmx500m server and it should be online.

Hope I helped. If not, then follow this tut: https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=423797.0

Okay I didn’t know the files needed to be changed thank you on that.
Also I followed your steps that you’ve provided and I get this error.

[sup]Brandons-MacBook-Pro:DevilsScape Server brandongunda$ Java -Xmx500m server
Exception in thread “main” java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: server
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: server
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:202)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:190)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306)
at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:301)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:247)
Brandons-MacBook-Pro:DevilsScape Server brandongunda$

[/sup]
Any idea?

Alright… so what was in the Run.bat or whatever in the server’s main folder?
[/quote]

Inside the run.bat was

[quote]@echo off
title DevilsScape
cd src
cd …
“C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin\java” -Xmx256m -Xss2m -Dsun.java2d.noddraw=true -XX:+DisableExplicitGC -XX:+AggressiveOpts -XX:+UseAdaptiveGCBoundary -XX:MaxGCPauseMillis=500 -XX:SurvivorRatio=16 -XX:+UseParallelGC -classpath bin;lib/substance.jar;lib/* neo.Execute
pause[/quote]
I’m assuming that something needs to changed since mac doesn’t use “C:” right? Lol or nah…[/quote]

Replace all that with this:

cd src cd .. java -Xmx256m -Xss2m -Dsun.java2d.noddraw=true -XX:+DisableExplicitGC -XX:+AggressiveOpts -XX:+UseAdaptiveGCBoundary -XX:MaxGCPauseMillis=500 -XX:SurvivorRatio=16 -XX:+UseParallelGC -classpath bin:lib/substance.jar:lib/* neo.Execute

Read full topic

item.title: Mac Friendly Source & Client?
item.dc:creator: @Sideoutkid Sideoutkid
item.description:
@Sideoutkid wrote:

[quote=“Docent, post:5, topic:543553”][quote author=Sideoutkid link=topic=662433.msg4427625#msg4427625 date=1401583401]

Any server/client is compatible with Mac, you would just need to reconfigure the files.

Window users use .bat files, and you using Mac, don’t have .bat’s, so if you download a source/client then you need to change all of your .bat files to .sh

example:

runserver.bat compile.bat

needs to be changed to

runserver.sh compile.sh

Those would open as text files. So what you do:

Open Terminal Type "/cd "
Make sure you have a space after /cd
That will create a directory
Then drag the source to your Terminal
that will open your source for Mac.
Then type Java -Xmx500m server and it should be online.

Hope I helped. If not, then follow this tut: https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=423797.0

Okay I didn’t know the files needed to be changed thank you on that.
Also I followed your steps that you’ve provided and I get this error.

[sup]Brandons-MacBook-Pro:DevilsScape Server brandongunda$ Java -Xmx500m server
Exception in thread “main” java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: server
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: server
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:202)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:190)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306)
at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:301)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:247)
Brandons-MacBook-Pro:DevilsScape Server brandongunda$

[/sup]
Any idea?
[/quote]

Alright… so what was in the Run.bat or whatever in the server’s main folder?[/quote]

Inside the run.bat was

@echo off title DevilsScape cd src cd .. "C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin\java" -Xmx256m -Xss2m -Dsun.java2d.noddraw=true -XX:+DisableExplicitGC -XX:+AggressiveOpts -XX:+UseAdaptiveGCBoundary -XX:MaxGCPauseMillis=500 -XX:SurvivorRatio=16 -XX:+UseParallelGC -classpath bin;lib/substance.jar;lib/* neo.Execute pause
I'm assuming that something needs to changed since mac doesn't use "C:\" right? Lol or nah...

Read full topic

item.title: Mac Friendly Source & Client?
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

[quote=“Sideoutkid, post:1, topic:543553”]Hey guys, I’m looking into making my own private server.

My only problem is finding a source / client compatible with mac.
I’ve read some posts about how some files are different for different users,
and how most people prefer windows / linux. (Well I’m stuck with a mac lol)

If anyone could help me out, it would be much appreciated!

Thanks for your time

  • The Kid[/quote]

These servers are all compatible with mac lol. You just need to change the .bat files to .sh and edit the code in there so it can run on a mac.
